repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: Python 3.12 and upwards (since this is where the limited API exposes the protocol). In principle we could probably use the "backport vectorcall" mechanism, but that doesn't seem in the spirit of the limited api.

comment_data.body:
This exception generation code is used a lot. Seems worth moving it into a helper function. Or two, given the second case with the argument size. That would also centralise the "get name + decref" code and avoid additional global declarations for it.

(I considered [PyErr_FormatV](https://docs.python.org/3/c-api/exceptions.html#c.PyErr_FormatV), but I don't think that fits nicely with additionally passing the function name.)
I've turned it into a couple of helper macros. I was struggling to make the "size" argument version work with a function. Hopefully that's a bit clearer.

commit.message:
Enable vectorcall on limited api cyfunctions

Python 3.12 and upwards (since this is where the limited API
exposes the protocol). In principle we could probably use
the "backport vectorcall" mechanism, but that doesn't seem
in the spirit of the limited api.
Attempt to factor out repeated exception formatting
